<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 373, 369, 388]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 397, 680, 412]]<|/det|>
Write your centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 412, 300, 426]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 426, 479, 440]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 440, 479, 454]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 453, 363, 467]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 478, 243, 492]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 492, 343, 506]]<|/det|>
Electronic calculators may be used.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 505, 730, 520]]<|/det|>
You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 530, 576, 545]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 544, 722, 559]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[74, 69, 89, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 69, 875, 102]]<|/det|>
A student investigates how the resistance of a filament lamp changes with the potential difference (p.d.) across it.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 98, 405, 116]]<|/det|>
He uses the circuit shown in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 67, 806, 87]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 67, 875, 101]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[74, 69, 91, 85]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 69, 803, 85]]<|/det|>
A student is investigating ways of slowing the rate of cooling of hot liquids in a container.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 82, 875, 115]]<|/det|>
The student knows that a lid will reduce the rate of cooling. He wants to find out if the thickness of the lid makes any difference to the rate of cooling.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 127, 860, 144]]<|/det|>
Plan an experiment which will enable him to compare the effects of lids of different thicknesses.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 157, 308, 173]]<|/det|>
In your plan, you should:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 186, 386, 203]]<|/det|>
list the apparatus needed

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 217, 875, 248]]<|/det|>
explain briefly how you would carry out the investigation, including the measurements to be taken

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 261, 658, 278]]<|/det|>
state any key variables that would need to be kept the same

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 291, 875, 322]]<|/det|>
draw a suitable table or tables, with column headings, to show how the readings would be displayed (you are **not** required to enter any readings in the table)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 335, 688, 351]]<|/det|>
explain how you would use your readings to reach a conclusion.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 364, 546, 380]]<|/det|>
You may draw a diagram if it helps to explain your plan.
